studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) 3 mg
arms.description: Single 3-mg dose of LY900018 powder administered via nasal dosing device by study site personnel.

arms.name: Intramuscular Glucagon (IMG) 1 mg
arms.description: Single 1-mg dose of GlucaGen administered via intramuscular injection by study site personnel.

studyCohorts.name: Patients with T1DM
studyCohorts.characteristic: Japanese patients with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus based on WHO diagnostic criteria.

studyCohorts.name: Patients with T2DM
studyCohorts.characteristic: Japanese patients with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus based on WHO diagnostic criteria.

studyInterventions.name: IV Glucose
studyInterventions.description: Administered for insufficient response to glucagon or severe hypoglycemia

titles.text: A Phase 3 Study of Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) Compared to Intramuscular Glucagon for Treatment of Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

indications.name: Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus
indications.description: Treatment of Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

study.name: A Phase 3 Study of Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) Compared to Intramuscular Glucagon for Treatment of Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

substances.name: Glucagon
substances.description: Synthetic single-chain, 29-amino-acid polypeptide identical to human glucagon

narrativeContents.name: Study Governance, Regulatory and Ethical Considerations
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Study Governance, Regulatory and Ethical Considerations

narrativeContents.name: Hepatic Monitoring Tests for Treatment-emergent Abnormality
narrativeContents.sectionTitle: Hepatic Monitoring Tests for Treatment-emergent Abnormality

abbreviations.expandedText: area under the concentration versus time curve

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 3 Study of Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) Compared to Intramuscular Glucagon for Treatment of Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

studyAmendments.summary: The specific rationale text for this amendment is located in Appendix 9 (Page 71) of the protocol, which is not included in the provided document excerpts. The Table of Contents lists this section as 'Protocol Amendment I8R-JE-IGBJ(a) Summary'.

procedures.name: Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia
procedures.label: Hypoglycemia Induction
procedures.description: Procedure to induce hypoglycemia using IV insulin infusion targeting nadir glucose around 50 mg/dL

procedures.name: Nasal Administration
procedures.label: Nasal Dosing
procedures.description: Administration of LY900018 via nasal dosing device

procedures.name: Intramuscular Injection
procedures.label: IM Injection
procedures.description: Administration of intramuscular glucagon (IMG) requiring reconstitution

code.decode: Therapeutic, prophylactic, or diagnostic injection (specify substance or drug); subcutaneous or intramuscular

procedures.name: Venipuncture
procedures.label: Blood Sampling
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for PK, PD, and safety laboratory tests

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Bedside PG Monitoring
procedures.label: Glucose Monitoring
procedures.description: Serial blood sampling to monitor bedside plasma glucose levels

procedures.name: Vital Signs Assessment
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Measurement of supine blood pressure, pulse rate, and body temperature

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.name: Nasal Inspection
procedures.label: Nasal Exam
procedures.description: Inspection of the nasal cavity for both IMG and LY900018 groups

procedures.name: Injection-Site Assessment
procedures.label: Injection Site Exam
procedures.description: Assessment of the injection site for IMG group only

procedures.name: Urine Pregnancy Test
procedures.label: Pregnancy Test
procedures.description: Urine pregnancy test for female patients of childbearing potential

procedures.name: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.label: Drug Screen
procedures.description: Screening for drugs of abuse in urine

medicalDevices.name: Nasal Dosing Device
medicalDevices.label: Nasal Device
medicalDevices.description: User-friendly, single-use, nasal dosing device for powder formulation

medicalDevices.name: Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.label: CSII
medicalDevices.description: Insulin pump used by patients for daily therapy

medicalDevices.name: Glucose Monitor
medicalDevices.label: PG Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Device used for bedside plasma glucose monitoring

conditions.name: Hypoglycemia Induction Target
conditions.description: Target PG level to stop insulin infusion

conditions.name: Admission PG Requirement
conditions.description: PG level required to proceed with admission procedures
conditions.text: PG level is 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review Criteria
conditions.description: Trigger for safety review before dosing remaining patients

conditions.name: ADA Follow-up Cessation
conditions.text: Titer returns to baseline (within 2-fold dilution) OR 1 year after last dose

conditions.name: Hypoglycemia Questionnaire Trigger
conditions.description: PG threshold for 'During hypoglycemia induction' questionnaire

transitionRules.name: Induction to Treatment
transitionRules.text: Once bedside PG reaches <60 mg/dL, insulin infusion is stopped and approximately 5 minutes later study drug is administered

transitionRules.name: Safety Pause
transitionRules.text: Safety data reviewed after first 6 patients complete Period 2; remaining patients dosed after confirmation of safety

transitionRules.name: Admission Rescheduling
transitionRules.text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1

transitionRules.name: Safety Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Investigator decides patient should be discontinued due to AE, SAE, or severe hypoglycemia event

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient request, investigator decision, or enrollment in another study

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Stoppage
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Study stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety after review of first 6 patients

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and unable to be contacted

analysisPopulations.name: All Entered Set Population
analysisPopulations.label: AES
analysisPopulations.description: All patients who sign inform consent and enter in this study
analysisPopulations.criteria: Signed informed consent and entered study

analysisPopulations.name: All Randomized Set Population
analysisPopulations.label: ARS
analysisPopulations.description: All patients who are randomized to study treatments

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set Population
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.description: All randomized patients who receive at least 1 dose of study drug. Used for safety analyses and other efficacy analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Randomized and received at least 1 dose

analysisPopulations.name: Efficacy Analysis Set Population
analysisPopulations.label: EAS
analysisPopulations.description: Patients in the FAS and have evaluable primary efficacy outcome. Used for primary efficacy analysis.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In FAS and have evaluable primary efficacy outcome

analysisPopulations.name: PK/PD Population
analysisPopulations.label: PK/PD
analysisPopulations.description: Patients in the FAS and have evaluable PK/PD
analysisPopulations.criteria: In FAS and have evaluable PK/PD

commentAnnotations.text: Note to Regulatory Authorities: This document may contain protected personal data and/or commercially confidential information exempt from public disclosure.
Patients do not need to fast for samples at screening or follow-up. At Periods 1 and 2, samples should be collected from patients who have fasted at least 8 hours before any study procedures.
Serum pregnancy test will be performed at screening. Urine pregnancy test will be performed at every admission period and follow-up visit if applicable.
Additional tests can be done at the discretion of the investigator.
